rich_narrative.summary: The Institute for Social Policy and Understanding (ISPU) is a research-driven organization dedicated to providing objective data and education regarding American Muslims. Since its inception, ISPU has positioned itself as a critical resource for policymakers and the media, aiming to foster a well-informed public square through rigorous analysis. The organization reported a <cite id="2">total revenue of $1,624,938 in 2023</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="2">$1,604,748 in contributions</cite>. ISPU maintains a <cite id="1">98.25/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a high standard of institutional accountability. Their work is structured around key initiatives such as the <cite id="4">American Muslim Poll and Reimagining Muslim Spaces</cite>, which provide empirical evidence to counter misinformation and support community development. While the organization does not provide direct humanitarian aid, its <cite id="5">capacity-building model</cite> equips change agents with the tools necessary to advocate for the American Muslim community. Financially, the organization is exceptionally stable, holding <cite id="1">22.6 months of working capital</cite>, which ensures that its research projects can withstand short-term funding fluctuations. This stability is paired with <cite id="1">efficient fundraising operations</cite>, costing only <cite id="1">$0.17 to raise every $1</cite>.
